column1: Eating a lot of paraffin can lead to intestinal obstruction, which can cause abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and possible constipation.
If the paraffin contains a dye, a person who has an allergy to that dye may develop tongue and throat swelling, wheezing, and trouble breathing.
If the person has an allergic reaction, call 911 or your local emergency number.
The person will likely be asked to drink large amounts of fluids to help remove the paraffin from the bowel.
